thread.title: For the sake of cricket: Danny Morrison gets license to dance with PSL cheergirls — WATCH | Zee News
thread.title_full: For the sake of cricket: Danny Morrison gets license to dance with PSL cheergirls — WATCH | Zee News

title: For the sake of cricket: Danny Morrison gets license to dance with PSL cheergirls — WATCH | Zee News
text:
Follow @ZeeNewsSports 
New Delhi: Former New Zealand pacer Danny Morrison is no stranger to cricket fans thanks to his many stints in various Twenty20 cricket leagues around the world. 
The Pakistan Super League (PSL) became his latest stop, and it seemed, the 51-year-old has managed to convince organisers of the tournament to have a song and dance routine with beautiful cheer girls. . @SteelyDan66 as smooth as ever, the dancing shoes serve him well! #HBLPSL #AbKhelJamayGa pic.twitter.com/uENeGHxtVK 
But, that's not all that he has managed to do for the sake of cricket. He was also seen having more fun time with fans. He has indeed upgraded his entertainment quotient. 
Watch the videos here: 
Known as 'Duckman', Morrison is regarded as one of the best entertainers in cricket circles. He has had commentary, presenter stints in Indian Premier League and other T20 leagues. 
The second edition of PSL kicked off in Dubai on February 9. The final is scheduled for March 7, to be played at Lahore. 
But the choice of Pakistani city has raised security concerns to many overseas players taking part in the league. First Published: Friday, February 24, 2017 - 23:29 More from zeenews
